item.title: Future of Gaming /w Video
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

There is a 3d version of AssaultCube made for the Vuzix VR920 that I posted about on the top of page 2, I tried it and it was pretty amazing. I still think Wii/PS3 are both better than the 360, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of Gaming /w Video
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

wow the head and finger tracking stuff is beast, as is this: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9JK6D8-UVSE

i have a ps3 and im not really a wii fan, but theres no denying the funness of wii sports and the amazing possibilities that the console has. right now i would say that ps3 and xbox360 are both better (at least for what i want out of a gaming console), but if game developers are creative, the wii could be the greatest console ever, by far. considering that the people who have come up with this stuff (the head and finger tracking, air drums, all this other cool wiimote stuff) are doing it on their own time while maintaining a job/going to school, think of what game developers who have actual experience in the field and are paid a damn good amount of money to come up with ideas like those could do? rock band-esque game, with air drums and on-screen keyboard (the musical kind) that can be played via infrared gloves or something? 3D first person shooters with head tracking? the possibilities are endless.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of Gaming /w Video
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Oh okay.
It is actually VERY useful for school work, not so much gaming. I did not get the WLAN option [still my idiot dean confiscated it and made me get permission from each teacher to use it, which I never did.].
My friends laptop is widescreen, and I picked it up and did some stuff for him on it, I swear it was more than 10 pounds!
About what I said before - my desktop is only a LITTLE bit better, I’m still amazed they could create it in laptop form. It does have an ATI HD 2400 [not mobility :P], but its got a bigger hard drive/some better stats.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“cooper, post:25, topic:172132”][quote author=robocz033 link=topic=232260.msg1998424#msg1998424 date=1200444331]
my laptop is insanely powerful. more powerful than my desktop, and most other desktops for that matter. my friends desktop which cost double what my laptop top did isnt nearly as powerful (i have a 2ghz dual core processor, his is 1.35 dual core; we both have 2 gig ram, he has a slightly better gfx card, but other than that, we are the same or im better)
[/quote]
What model are they?[/quote]

umm. not sure on his. but mine is a toshiba satellite A215

[quote=“exps35, post:26, topic:172132”][quote author=robocz033 link=topic=232260.msg1998424#msg1998424 date=1200444331]
my laptop is insanely powerful. more powerful than my desktop, and most other desktops for that matter. my friends desktop which cost double what my laptop top did isnt nearly as powerful (i have a 2ghz dual core processor, his is 1.35 dual core; we both have 2 gig ram, he has a slightly better gfx card, but other than that, we are the same or im better)
[/quote]

so think again.

item.title: Future of Gaming /w Video
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Headtracking with the wiimote is amazing, but in my opinion there are better options. Most headtrackers make your monitor a “window” to another world, but wouldn’t it be even better to be “in” another world? That is why I am trying to get money for this: http://www.vuzix.com/iwear/products_vr920.html. Unlike TrackIR and other headtrackers, it only works with 3DOF instead of 6, but still, it makes your gaming much more interesting and exciting.

Read full topic
